week2.title: The Intervening Bystander App
week2.subtitle: Using software to improve campus safety
week2.text:
Problem

NYUAD is a small and tight-knit community of a little over 1,000 students. We know most of the studentsâ€™ faces as interactions are inevitable at this condensed and communal campus. This lack of anonymity guarantees a certain level of safety on campus because harassment and crime committed by strangers, common at other GNU campuses in city centers, are mostly absent. Yet this small size of student body alone does not guarantee safety. The different legal standards in this country also makes it hard to handle certain offenses.

Solution

Prevention effort, therefore, might be the most effective. The Bystander Intervention is known as a very effective prevention strategy that involves the crowd as an intervening force before the crime actually happens. I want to build an app that allows anonymous reporting of a situation that may escalate to be harmful.
